title:
Role of the Adsorption of Alkali Cations on Ultrathin $n$-Layers of
  Two-dimensional Perovskites
authors:
Israel C. Ribeiro, Pedro Ivo R. Moraes, Albert F. B. Bittencourt, and
  Juarez L. F. Da Silva
abstract:
Metal-halide semiconductors have great potential for real-life photovoltaic
applications; however, surface defects induce several challenges to the
thermodynamic stability. Here, we employed density functional theory
calculations within van der Waals corrections (D3) to investigate the role of
monovalent cations (Li, Na, K, Rb and Cs) in the passivation of 2D perovskite
ultrathin films.
